So, the other clause will also be in past tense. and helping verb of past perfect tense 'had' will be used. Correct sentence :- The ambulance had arrived on time, the accident victim was taken to the hospital.

Spotting error.question: The Public Works Department has propose to construct an elevated corridor which will run parallel to the National highway.
options: The Public Works Department has propose
Spotting error.explanation: It is clear from the use of Helping verb 'has' in the above sentence that the sentence is in Present Perfect tense and its structure is as follows IIISubject has / have V form other words+ + + Thereafter in place of 'propose', 'proposed' verb3 will be used in the sentence. Correct Sentence- The Public Works Department has proposed to construct an elevated corridor which will run parallel to the National highway

Spotting error.question: I declined the lunch offer by Suresh, not because I do not want to go, but because I had no time.
options: but because I had no time
I do not want to go
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence ' I did not' will be used in place of 'I do not' because It is clear from V2 (Declaimed) that the sentence is in past tense. Hence the next clause is also in Past tense so 'did' will be used in place of 'do'. Correct sentence- I declined the lunch offer by Suresh, not because I did not want to go, but because I had no time.

Spotting error.question: Did you know whether we can exchange the dress if my sister doesn't like it?
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'Do you know whether will be used in place of 'Did you know whether' because according to the sense of the sentence it is in present tense. As it is clear from sub-ordinate clause (doesn't like) Correct Sentence- Do you know whether we can exchange the dress if my sister doesn't like it?

Spotting error.question: A Delhi bound aircraft has to make an emergency landing at Mumbai airport as a woman passenger suddenly developed a serious breathing problem.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'had to make' will be used in place of 'has to make' because it is clear from the second clause that the sentence is in past tense. Correct Sentence- A Delhi bound aircraft had to make an emergency landing at Mumbai airport as a woman passenger suddenly developed a serious breathing problem.

Spotting error.question: Samurai jack drawn his sword to exact revenge on his superiors.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence V2 (drew) will be used in place of V3 (drawn) because above sentence is Affirmative sentence of past Indefinite tense and second form of verb is used in it. Note- Past Indefinite Negative Interrogative Sentence, helping verb, 'did' and verb first form is used. Correct Sentence Samurai jack drew his sword to exact revenge on his superiors,

Spotting error.question: Often hailed as one of the greatest industry leaders of india, Ratan Tata take across the reins of the company, leading from the front.
options: the greatest industry leaders from india,
Ratan Tata take across the reins of the company
Spotting error.answer: **Ratan Tata take across the reins of the company**
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'took over' will be used in place of 'take across' because according to the sense of the sentence it is in Past Indefinite tense. Hence second form of verb (took) will be used. Correct Sentence Often hailed as one of the greatest industry leaders of india, Ratan Tata took over the reins of the company, leading from the front.

Spotting error.question: Mani Kaul begun his career as an actor and a director of short films before doing his debut feature film, 'Uski Roti,'
options: begun his career as an actor
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence second form of verb 'began' will be used in place of third form of verb 'begun' because the sentence is in past Indefinite tense. begin began begun Ist IInd IIIrd → → Correct sentence Mani Kaul began his career as an actor and a director of short films before doing his debut feature film, 'Uski Roti,'

Spotting error.question: People with full time sedentary job who commuting long distances, may have sleep problems due to lack of exercise.
options: people with full time sedentary jobs
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'who commute long distance' will be used in place of 'who commuting long distances' because here V1 (commute) is needed in present Indefinite tense. Since relative pronoun 'who' is used for subject people (plural noun) hence plural verb (verb1) without 's/es' is used after 'who'. Correct Sentence : People with full time sedentary jobs who commute long distances may have sleep problem due to lack of exercise.

Spotting error.question: The Indian cricket team was done very well this year and is ranked number one now.
options: and is ranked number one now
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'has' will be used in place of 'was' because the use of Adverb 'now' makes it clear Present time moment. Hence, present perfect tense is used. Note- was + done (V3) is used in passive voice. Correct Sentence : The Indian cricket team has done very well this year and is ranked number one now.

Spotting error.question: The country has to struggled with the problems of child labour.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'to struggle' will be used in place of 'to struggled' because first from of verb (VI) is used after 'to' ( )1Infinitive To V− + Correct Sentence : The country has to struggle with the problems of child labour.

Spotting error.question: Freedom of expression meaning the right to express one's own convictions and beliefs.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'means the right' will be used in place of 'meaning the right' because the sentence is in Present Indefinite tense. Hence verb1 will be used. Correct Sentence : Freedom of expression means the right to express one's own convictions and beliefs.

Spotting error.question: Have I ever told you what lovely pickles my grandmother used to made when she was in Visakhapatnam?
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'used to make' will be used in place of 'used to made' because the structure 'to + VI' is used as an infinitive. Correct Sentence : Have I ever told you what lovely pickles my grandmother used to make when she was in Visakhapatnam?

Spotting error.question: Ayan told Sriram, "Don't worry I can be able to climb that tree to reach the fruit."
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'I am able to' will be used in place of 'I can be able to' because the use of able with can is superfluous. Hence 'am able' gives appropriate meaning according to the sense of the sentence. Correct Sentence : Ayan told Sriram, "Don't worry I am able to climb that tree to reach the fruit."

Spotting error.question: Firecrackers have seized by the government went off while being defused on the banks of the river Ganga, in a town in West Bengal.
options: on the banks of the river Ganga
Firecrackers have seized by the government
in a town in West Bengal
Spotting error.explanation: The above sentence is in passive voice So Firecrackers have been seized by the government is used in place of 'Firecrackers have seized by the government' because the passive voice structure of present perfect tense is as follows :– Object + has/have + been + VIII + by + subject + other. Correct Sentence : Firecrackers have been seized by the government went off while being defused on the banks of the river Ganga, in a town in West Bengal.

Spotting error.question: A 12 year old archer was airlifted to Delhi when he met with an accident while practice for the Khelo India Games in Guwahati.
options: when he met with an accident
while practice for the Khelo India Games
Spotting error.answer: **while practice for the Khelo India Games**
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'While practicing for the Khelo India Games' will be used in place of 'While practice for the Khelo India Games' because 'ing' form of the verb is generally used with 'while'. Correct Sentence : A 12 year old archer was airlifted to Delhi when he met with an accident while practicing for the Khelo India Games in Guwahati.

Spotting error.question: When Harry come back home, he saw blood everywhere.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'came back home' will be used in place of 'come back home' because the main clause of sentence, simple past, hence the subordinate clause will also be in simple past. Hence came (V2) will be used instead of come (VI) Correct Sentence : When Harry came back home, he saw blood everywhere.

Spotting error.question: If revenues remain healthy, the (1)/ government would, over time, get the necessary (2)/fiscal room to rationalizes multiple GST rate. (3)/No error (4)
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'to rationalize' will be used in place of 'to rationalizes' because 'to + VI' is used. Hence Rationalize will be used without s/es. Correct Sentence : If revenues remain healthy, the government would, over time, get the necessary fiscal room to rationalize multiple GST rate.

Spotting error.question: In July, the government promulgate(1)/a law that enables the banning (2)/of political parties.(3)/ No error (4)
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'promulgated' will be used in place of 'promulgate' because according to the sense of sentence Past Indefinite tense will be appropriate. Hence verb2 (V 2) will be used. Correct Sentence : In July, the government promulgated a law that enables the banning of political parties.

Spotting error.question: Mumbai was crawling at a (1) / snail's pace yesterday, is slowly (2) / returning to normalcy. (3) / No Error (4)
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'which was crawling' will be used in place of 'was crawling' because Pronoun 'which' will be used for subject (Mumbai). because two verb (was, is) are given in the sentence while only one subject (mumbai) is used. So another suitable subject will be used according to the sense of sentence. Correct Sentence - Mumbai, which was crawling at a snail's pace yesterday, is slowly returning to normalcy.

Spotting error.question: But migrant laborers who (a)/ are being working inside the (b)/ premises for years. (c)/ No Error (d).
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'have been working' will be used in place of 'are being working' because 'for + period of time' is given in the following sentence. So Present Perfect continuous tense will be used. has/have + been + verb1 + ing. Correct Sentence : But migrant laborers who have been working inside the premises for years.

Spotting error.question: Since they got something (1)/ different each month, (2)/they keep coming back to it. (3)/ No Error (4)
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence get (V1) will be used in place of got (V2) because second clause is in present indefinite tense (keep). Hence v1 (get) will be used in the other clause. Correct Sentence : Since they get something different each month, they keep coming back to it.

Spotting error.question: Even if we missed a day's work, (1)/ out salaries are not cut and we (2) / were paid in full. (3)/ No Error (4)
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'were' will be used in place of 'are' because it is clear from the use of 'we missed and were paid' in the sentence that the sentence is in past tense. Correct Sentence : Even if we missed a day's work, out salaries were not cut and we were paid in full.

Spotting error.question: Tension prevail late on Friday after (a)/ angry protesters pelted stones at the police, (b)/torched vehicles and vandalized publics property (c)/ No Error (d)
Spotting error.explanation: It is clear from the second clause of the above sentence that the sentence is in Past Indefinite Tense. So in the first part of sentence prevailed (V2) will be used in place of prevail. Correct Sentence : Tension prevailed late on Friday after angry protesters pelted stones at the police, torched vehicles and vandalized publics property.

Spotting error.question: Over the years our trainers (1)/did helped students to clear the (2)/language tests for various countries. (3)/ No Error (4).
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'helped' will be used in place of 'did helped' because in affirmative sentences of past Indefinite tense, only second form of verb is used without 'did'. Note–S + VIInd form + Obj. (Assertive) Sub + did not + V1 + Obj. (Negative) Did + Sub + V1 + Obj. (Interrogative) Correct Sentence : Over the years our trainers helped students to clear the language tests for various countries.

Spotting error.question: He went up to her and asks her why she had insulted him./No error
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'asked' will be used in place of 'ask' because first clause (went) in past tense. Hence second clause will be in past Indefinite tense. Correct Sentence- He went up to her and asked her why she had insulted him.

Spotting error.question: He has deposits all his money in banks./No error
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence Deposited (V3) will be used in place of 'Deposits' because it is clear from the use of 'has' that the sentence is in present perfect tense. has/ have + V3 hence will be used. Correct sentence : He has deposited all his money in banks.

Spotting error.question: Kaira has upset with me since the accident.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'has been' will be used in place of 'has' because it is clear from the use of 'Since + point of time' that the sentence is in Present Perfect continuous hence 'has been' + v3' is used. Correct Sentence :- Kaira has been upset with me since the accident.

Spotting error.question: Radha woke up early that morning so that she should watch the beautiful sunrise.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'could' will be used in place of 'should' because could will be used for possibility. Correct sentence : Radha woke up that morning so that she could watch the beautiful sunrise.

Spotting error.question: Harish is spending two hours every morning reading newspapers in different languages.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'spends' will be used in place of 'is spending' because Present Indefinite tense is used for habitual action. Correct Sentence : Harish spends two hours every morning reading newspapers in different languages.

Spotting error.question: He started life as a teacher before turn to journalism.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'before turning' will be used in place of 'before turn' Rule :– Preposition at, in, on, to , before, after, for, from, about etc are followed by verb's ing form. Correct sentence :- He started life as a teacher before turning to journalism.

Spotting error.question: The more he earned the more he want to earn./No error.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'wanted' will be used in place of 'want' because if the main clause of the sentence is in the past tense then other clause also will be used in the past. Correct sentence :- The more he earned the more he wanted to earn.

Spotting error.question: Either of the two books will met my requirement./No error
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'will meet' will be used in place of 'will met' because Ist form of verb is used with modal verb 'will'. Correct sentence :- Either of the two books will meet my requirement.

Spotting error.question: She wanted to telling you who you could approach for your problem./No error
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'she wanted to tell you' will be used in place of 'she wanted to telling you' because verb1 with infinitive 'to' Note– Want, promise, learn, manage etc. (to +V1) Correct sentence :- She wanted to tell you who you could approach for your problem.

Spotting error.question: All the students/is done/better this year.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'have done' will be used in place of 'is done' because according to the sense of the sentence it is in present perfect tense. Hence has/have + V3 will be used. Correct sentence :- All the students have done better this year.

Spotting error.question: Rakesh is foolish/to said/such things.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'to say' will be used in place of 'to said' because the verb coming after 'to' is in VIst form. Note - to + verb1 Correct sentence :- Rakesh is foolish to say such things.

Spotting error.question: I told the tailor/to made a new/dress for me./No error.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'To make a new' will be used in place of 'to made a new' because to + VI is use as infinitive. Correct sentence :- I told the tailor to make a new dress for me.

Spotting error.question: Jaya asked Sushmita to reminds her about the meeting.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'to remind' will be used in place of 'to reminds' because here infinitive has been used in which is appropriate Correct sentence :- Jaya asked Sushmita to remind her about the meeting.

Spotting error.question: Zainab was played with/her friends in the park/when she noticed Disha/walking away with a stranger.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'Playing' will be used in place of 'Played' because the given sentence is in active voice of Past continuous. Hence (was/were + V1 + ing) will be used. Correct sentence : ''Zainab was playing with her friends in the park when She noticed Disha walking away with a stranger.''

Spotting error.question: The priest request all the wealthy men to donate money for building a new temple.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above Sentence 'requested' will be used in place of 'request' because according to sense of the given sentence it will be used in past Indefinite tense. Correct sentence : The priest requested all the wealthy men to donate money for building a new temple.

Spotting error.question: She misplaced her spectacles and now finding it difficult to read.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'found' will be used in place of finding' because the first clause of the sentence she (misplaced) is in past tense. Hence the later clause will also be used in past. Correct sentence : She misplaced her spectacles and found it difficult to read.

Spotting error.question: I don't think I meet him before
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'I met' will be used in place of 'I meet' because according to sense of the sentence. The verb of Past Indefinite tense will be used according to the sense of the sentence. Correct sentence : 'I don't think I met him before'.

Spotting error.question: The company has invested a great deal of time and effort to setting up new training schemes.
options: time and effort to setting up
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'to set up' will be used in place of 'to setting up' because the verb after the infinitive 'to' is used in the first form. Correct sentence- The company has invested a great deal of time and effort to set up new training schemes.

Spotting error.question: For most citizens today. liberty meant the freedon to practise their religious or political beliefs.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'means' will be used in place of 'meant' because the word 'today' makes it clear that the sentence is in Present Indefinite Tense then verb1 + s/es (singular verb) is used. Correct sentence- For most citizens today, liberty means the freedom to practice their religious or political beliefs.

Spotting error.question: When they started, they had great ideas but lack the business know-how.
Spotting error.explanation: It is clear from the verb 'started' in the above sentence that the sentence is in past tense because verb2 is used in the sentence which is clear that the next part will also in the past tense. Hence 'lacked' will be used in place of 'lack'. Correct sentence- When they started, they had great ideas but lacked the business know-how.

Spotting error.question: The government's proposal has been set alarm bells ringing for people with low incomes.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'has' will be used in place of 'has been' because the sentence is in Active voice. in which has/have + verb3 is used. Correct sentence- The government's proposal has set alarm bells ringing for people with low incomes.

Spotting error.question: Some people is always talking about themselves./No error
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'always talk' will be used in place of 'is always talking' because always shows a habitual action. Hence simple present tense will be used. and with plural noun (people) is used with plural verb (verb1) without s/es. Correct Sentence - Some people always talk about themselves.

Spotting error.question: I have got my Master's degree in 2005.
Spotting error.explanation: In the given sentence 'I got' (simple past tense) will be used in place of I have got Present Perfect tense because the time of past (2005) is given in the sentence. Correct Sentence - I got my Master's degree in 2005.

Spotting error.question: The use of new technology has bring down the price of books.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'brought down' will be used in place of 'bring' down' because it is clear from the use of 'has' that the sentence is in Present Perfect tense. In which has/have + V3 is used. Correct sentence- The use of new technology has brought down the price of books.

Spotting error.question: For a long time the publishing market excluding the poor.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'has been excluding' will be used in place of 'excluding' because the structure of perfect continuous tense because for + time (period of time) is given. Correct sentence- For a long time the publishing market has been excluding the poor.

Spotting error.question: The Supreme Court has the power to modification or cancel laws in the country.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'to modify' will be used in place of 'to modification' because to + VI is used as an infinitive. Which works as a noun. Correct sentence- The Supreme Court has the power to modify or cancel laws in the country.

Spotting error.question: Hackers can either tampers with a random number generator of figure out the resultant number easily in case of online gaming.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'Hackers can either tamper' will be used in place of 'Hackers can either tampers' because the verb (VI) is used after the modal 'can'. Therefore temper without s/es will be used instead of tempers. Correct sentence- Hackers can either tamper with a random number generator of figure out the resultant number easily in case of online gaming.

Spotting error.question: Computers everywhere use random numbers as keys to locked or unlock encrypted information.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'Lock' will be used in place of 'Locked' because infinitive 'to' is generally followed by verb Ist form. Correct Sentence : Computers everywhere use random numbers as keys to lock or unlock encrypted information.

Spotting error.question: With the help of skill-based education offer in colleges, many students will become eligible for various jobs.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'will be' is used in place of 'will become' because the sentence is in simple future. In which subject + will/shall + be + other word is used. Correct Sentence : With the help of skill-based education offer in colleges, many students will be eligible for various jobs.

Spotting error.question: Dr. Rana is our teacher of English since this semester.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'has been' will be used in place of 'is' because it is clear from the use of 'Since' that the sentence is in present perfect continuous tense. Sub + has/have + been + verb + ing + object + since/for + time. Correct sentence - Dr. Rana has been our teacher of English since this semester.

Spotting error.question: Ram always tries to do things very carefully and made sure he does them correctly.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'and make sure' will be used in place of 'and made sure' because the sentence is in present Indefinite Tense. and 'Ram' is a singular subject so singular verb verb1 + s/es will be used for it. Correct sentence - Ram always tries to do things very carefully and makes sure he does them correctly.

Spotting error.question: The man greeted his secretary and told her that he need her help to complete the work immediately.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence the main clause is in past tense. Therefore the subordinate clause will be also in past tense Hence 'needed' will be used in place of 'need'. Correct sentence - The man greeted his secretary and told her that he needed her help to complete the work immediately.

Spotting error.question: Neither I nor my friends are going too walk down that street.
Spotting error.explanation: There is an error of option (c) because adverb 'too' will be replaced by preposition 'to'. to + verb1 → work as a noon. The correct sentence is- 'Neither I nor my friends are going to walk down that street.

Spotting error.question: Never put of/until tomorrow what /you can do today.
Spotting error.explanation: For the above given segment option (a) will be used because 'put of' is replace by ' put off' which means 'To postpone doing something' The correct sentence is– 'Never put off until tomorrow what you can do today'.

Spotting error.question: Can you please help me to this project?
Spotting error.explanation: In the above given sentence in part (b) 'help me to' has an error, because the preposition 'with' is used in place of 'to'. Help → with → something. The correct sentence – Can you please help me with this project ?'

Spotting error.question: With reference of your letter, the organisation wishes to hire you for the security services.
options: the organisation wishes to hire you
Spotting error.explanation: The part of the sentence mentioned in option (b) with reference of your letter. contains error. It need to be replaced with 'with reference to it is an idiom which means about or concerning something/someone or in relation to. Correct Sentence with reference to your letter, the organization wishes to hire for the security services.

Spotting error.question: This region was struck by unusual wave of violence last year.
Spotting error.explanation: Part (a) "was struck by unusual" being erroneous, will be replaced by 'was struck with unusual'. Because 'struck with' means to have something you do not want because you can not get rid of it. Hence it is appropriate to be used in place of erroneous part. Correct sentence The region was struck with unusual wave of violence last year.

Spotting error.question: The government has been accused in not doing enough to combat climate change.
Spotting error.explanation: Part (a) 'accused in' of the sentence is erroneous. it has to be substituted with 'Accused of' to make the sentence grammatically correct. Because Accused is always followed by preposition (of). Correct Sentence The government has been accused of not doing enough to combat climate change.

Spotting error.question: The current state of the literature / on the efficacy under cognitive-behavioural therapy / for individuals with generalised anxiety disorder / suggests that it is a promising treatment option.
options: on the efficacy under cognitive-behavioural therapy
for individuals with generalised anxiety disorder
The current state of the literature
suggests that it is a promising treatment option.
Spotting error.answer: on the efficacy of cognitive – behavioural therapy
Spotting error.explanation: The error part of the given sentence is option (a) 'on the efficacy under cognitive–behavioural therapy.' Because 'of ' preposition is used in the place of 'under' according to the context of this sentence as it shows possession. The correct segment is– 'on the efficacy of cognitive – behavioural therapy'.

Spotting error.question: You will never regret this wonderful experience with your life.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'in' will be used in place of 'with' because Preposition 'in' is used with Experience. Correct Sentence- You will never regret this wonderful experience in your life.

Spotting error.question: No doubt, human minds are good on predicting the worst.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence "good at" will be used in place of "good on" because 'at' Preposition is used when 'good' use as an Adjective. Correct Sentence- No doubt, human minds are good at predicting the worst.

Spotting error.question: She persisted / to doing / what she wanted / despite opposition.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'in doing' will be used in place of 'to doing' because 'in' Preposition is used with persist. Persist + in + (Verb1 + ing). Correct Sentence- She persisted in doing what she wanted despite opposition.

Spotting error.question: The invited guests preferred orange juice than hot coffee or chilled grapes.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence, ‘to not coffee’ would be appropriate instead of ‘than not coffee’, because preposition ‘to’ is used with prefer. Correct Sentence :- The invited guests preferred orange juice to hot coffee or chilled grapes.

Spotting error.question: She was unable to produce sufficient evidences for support her accusations.
Spotting error.explanation: In the given sentence 'sufficient evidence to' will be used in place of 'sufficient evidences for' because here (to + VI) infinitive 'to support' will be used Correct Sentence- She was unable to produce sufficient evidence to support her accusations.

Spotting error.question: Rahul was ready for accept any job, even a part-time one.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'to' will be used in place of 'for' because in the sentence requires an infinitive (to + VI) as a Noun. Hence the use of 'to accept' would be appropriate. Correct sentence- Rahul was ready to accept any job, even a part-time one.

Spotting error.question: The street artist Satish Munjal has been painting this wall since the past one week.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence, ‘for’ will be used in place of ‘since’. Because 'for' is used for period of time in present continuous tense while ‘since’ is used for point of time. Rule:- Sub + has/have + been + V1+ing + for + Period of time. Correct sentence :- The street artist Satish Munjal has been painting this wall for the past one week.

Spotting error.question: Ritu was really annoyed as she had been waiting for me at the metro station for five O'clock.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'Since five O'clock' will be used in place of 'for five O'clock' use of for - The word 'for' is used to show a period of time. Two hours, two years etc. use of since - The word 'since' is used to refer to a point of time 15 August, March, 1988 etc. Correct Sentence - Ritu was really annoyed as she had been waiting for me at the metro station since five O'clock.

Spotting error.question: I have the courage/to say what's right;/I'm not afraid/from the consequences.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'of the consequences' will be used in place of 'from the consequences' because afraid generally followed by 'of' preposition. Correct Sentence- I have the courage to say what's right, I'm not afraid of the consequences.

Spotting error.question: The gentleman had a suitcase full with wigs, ornaments and dresses.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'full of' will be used in place of 'full with' because preposition 'of' is used with 'full'. Correct sentence– The gentleman had a suitcase full of wigs, ornaments and dresses.

Spotting error.question: The officer made me to type the letter again.
Spotting error.explanation: If the sentence is in Active voice of caustive verb then after make, bare infinitive (infinitive without to) is used but if the sentence is in passive voice then after 'make' infinitive with 'to' is used. Hence Bare infinitive (without 'to') will be used in the above sentence.

Spotting error.question: After a long trek/through the forest,/we arrived to the camp/around 8 p.m.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'at is used in place of to' because 'at' preposition is used for a definite place. Hence option (c) would be correct.

Spotting error.question: The migrating labourers were served hot meals for every town or village on their way.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'in every town' will be used in place of 'for every town' because Preposition 'in' is used with big place. Correct sentence - The migrating labourers were served hot meals in every town or village on their way.

Spotting error.question: In about two months,/our family will be/leaving to Australia/to settle there.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'Leaving for Australia' will be used in place of 'Leaving to Australia' because here 'for' preposition is used in place of 'to' preposition. (When we go away from one place and to another place, we use 'Leave for) Correct sentence- In about two month, our family will be leaving for Australia to settle there.

Spotting error.question: As I was sitting in the back of the theatre, I couldn't see the performance very well.
options: in the back of the theatre
Spotting error.answer: at the back of the theatre
Spotting error.explanation: There is a mistake in the above sentence in option (d). 'at' will be used in place of 'in' because 'at' preposition used for small definite place. Correct Sentence– 'As I was sitting at the back of the theatre, I couldn't see the performance very well.

Spotting error.question: The Konark temple/is dedicated/from the/Sun god.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'to' will be used in place of 'from' because dedicated is followed by 'to' preposition. Correct Sentence- The Konark temple is dedicated to the sun god.

Spotting error.question: Whenever he is/on a holiday,/he travels by foot/to the temple nearby.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'on foot' will be used in place of 'by foot' because 'on foot' is used in the sense of walking. Correct Sentence- Whenever he is on a holiday, he travels on foot to the temple nearby.

Spotting error.question: The river / flowed besides / the hillock / in our village.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'beside' will be used in place of 'besides' is appropriate according to the sense of 'to the side of'. Besides → In addition to Correct sentence– The river flowed beside the hillock in our villiage.

Spotting error.question: He was formerly/a doctor of/the corporate hospital.
Spotting error.explanation: There is an error of preposition 'of in' the given sentence 'At' is used to show the definite place/ Location, hence 'of' will replace by 'At'. Correct Sentence He was formerly a doctor at the corporate hospital.

Spotting error.question: He conceded/ a very crucial / point at / his opponent.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'Point to' will be used in place of 'Point at' because preposition 'to' is used in the case of acceptance. Correct sentence – He conceded a very crucial point to his opponent.

Spotting error.question: As it has been raining heavily / since two hours, / the children are / at home.
options: As it has been raining heavily
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'for' will be used in place of 'since' because 'for' is used before period of time and 'since' is used before point of time. Correct Sentence- As it has been raining heavily for two hours the children are at home.

Spotting error.question: We have/not met/some of our friends/since six months.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'for' will be used in place of 'Since' because since - point of time, (9 'o' clock, 1 January) for - period of time (six years, five minutes) Correct Sentence- We have not met some of our friends for six months.

Spotting error.question: Your name/precedes before mine/in the/admission list.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'Precedes mine' will be used in place of 'precedes before mine' because preposition 'before' is superfluous with precede. correct sentence – Your name precedes mine in the admission list.

Spotting error.question: Aid workers have delivered vast quantities of food on the refugee camps.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'to the refugee Camps' will be used in place of 'on the 'refugee Camps' because 'to' preposition is used with delivered. Note- Deliver something → to → something/somebody. Correct Sentence– Aid workers have delivered vast quantities of food to the refugee camps.

Spotting error.question: Concern above rising pollution / led to the / formulation of / various action plans.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'concern about rising pollution' will be used in place of 'Concern above rising pollution' because 'about' preposition is used with concern. Note – Concern about something Concern over something /some body. Correct Sentence– Concern about rising pollution led to the formulation of various action plans.

Spotting error.question: The reduced air pressure on airline flights can lessen the amount of oxygen in passengers' blood for twenty-five percent.
options: The reduced air pressure on airline flights
in passengers' blood for twenty-five percent
can lessen the amount of oxygen
Spotting error.answer: in passengers blood to twenty-five percent
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'to' will be used in place of 'for' because the preposition 'to' is generally used for 'Lessen'. Correct sentence– The reduced air pressure on airline fights can lessen the amount of oxygen in passengers blood to twenty-five percent.

Spotting error.question: I was at a party / with some off my / friends in Mumbai.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'with some of my' will be used in place of 'with some off my' because after some preposition 'of' is used. Note – Some → of → somebody / something. Correct Sentence – I was at a party with some of my friends in Mumbai.

Spotting error.question: Mohit is expecting / a huge profit / at his / recent investment.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'from his' will be used in place of 'at his' because 'from' is generally used as preposition in the sense of something with 'profit'. Correct Sentence - Mohit is expecting a huge profit from his recent investment.

Spotting error.question: He moved on the undergrowth / quickly and silently, / hiding himself / from the enemy.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'behind the undergrowth' will be used in place of 'on the undergrowth' because it gives appropriate meaning of the sentence. Correct Sentence– He moved behind the undergrowth quickly and silenty, hiding himself from the enemy.

Spotting error.question: She arrived / at / Monday morning / to attend the marriage.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'on' will be used in place of 'at' because the preposition 'on' is used before any day or date. On monday, On 6th June Correct sentence– She arrived on monday morning to attend the marriage.

Spotting error.question: I saw some / children playing happily / below the shade / of a tree.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'under the shade' will be used in place of 'below the shade' because' under the shade' is used in the sense of sit under the tree. Correct Sentence - I saw some children playing happily under the shade of a tree.

Spotting error.question: Water / freeze at / 0 degree / Celsius.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'Freeze' will be used in place of 'Freeze at' because in the sense of freezing 'at' preposition is not used. Correct sentence– Water freeze 0º degree celsius.

Spotting error.question: Why do they / keep talking on / about money / all the time?
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'Keep talking' will be used in the place of 'keep talking on' because used of 'on' preposition is superfluous. Correct sentence Why do they keep talking about money all the time.

Spotting error.question: We forgot / to wish Susan / in her birthday / this year.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'her birthday' will be used in place of 'in her birthday' because wish is followed by direct object with preposition. Note – wish for sth wish sb / sth on sb Correct sentence– We forgot to wish Susan her birthday this year.

Spotting error.question: A probe has been ordered/ by the incident/ that occurred at the celebrations.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'for' preposition will be used in place of 'by' because 'for' is used to denote something contains with order. * Order for something. * Order to somebody. Correct Sentence - A probe has been ordered for the incident that occurred at the celebrations.

Spotting error.question: The sports day events/ will be conducted/ from 3:30 pm and 5:30 pm/ on Saturday.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'to' will be used in place of 'and' because 'From......to' is used to show period of time. Correct Sentence - The sports day events will be conducted from 3:30 pm to 5:30 pm on Saturday.

Spotting error.question: Employees were given incentives based at their performance.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'based on' will be use in place of 'based at' because based is always followed by 'on' preposition. Correct Sentence - Employees were given incentives based on their performance.

Spotting error.question: Several prominent film stars/have appeared on television/on behalf of awareness/about hand hygiene.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'for' will be used in place of 'on behalf of' because according to the sentence it given appropriate meaning. Correct Sentence - Several prominent film stars have appeared on television for awareness about hand hygiene.

Spotting error.question: Won't you/please come/to help me/along this heavy box ?
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'for this heavy box' will be used in place of 'along the heavy box' because 'for' preposition gives suitable meaning of the sentence. Correct Sentence - Won't you please come to help me for this heavy box.

Spotting error.question: This jewellery box is made from silver and is an antique piece.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'of' will be used in place of 'from' because 'from' is used for chemical change and 'of' is used for physical change' The sentence is talking about making a silver box. Hence preposition 'of' would be appropriate. Correct sentence- This jewellery box is made of silver and is an antique piece.

Spotting error.question: Poor people have run down of food supplies during the lockdown.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'run out of' will be used in place of 'run down of' because it gives appropriate meaning. run down of - Slow down run out of - To End Correct sentence - Poor people have run out of food supplies during the lockdown.

Spotting error.question: We reserved tickets for a journey on train for the next morning for my sisters and me.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'by' preposition will be used in place of 'on' because it gives appropriate meaning. Correct sentence- We reserved by tickets for a journey by train for the next morning for my sisters and me.

Spotting error.question: The Principal was extremely angry on the boys who threw the pieces of chalk at the teacher.
options: who threw the pieces of chalk
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'angry at' will be used in place of 'angry on' because angry is followed by following preposition. angry on something/material. angry at somebody/someone. Correct sentence- The Principal was extremely angry at the boys who threw the pieces of chalk at the teacher.

Spotting error.question: The actor smiled to me when I entered the room as if she knew me.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'at' will be used in place of 'to' because smile at someone/ somebody is used. Correct sentence- The actor smiled at me when I entered the room as if she knew me.

Spotting error.question: It is difficult to make out that they are twins because they do not resemble to each other.
options: it is difficult to make out
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'resemble' will be used in the place of 'resemble to' because resemble is not followed by any preposition. Correct Sentence- It is difficult to make out that they are twins because they do not resemble each other.

Spotting error.question: Each student will have to carry his own lunch on the picnic.
Spotting error.explanation: According to the sense of above sentence 'to' preposition will be used in place of 'on' because in the sense of destination preposition 'to' is used. Correct sentence- Each student will have to carry his own lunch to the picnic.

Spotting error.question: I have been living in Delhi since many years
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'for' will be used in place of 'since' because many years is a period of time. since- used to show a point of time. for- used to show a period of time. Correct sentence- I have been living in Delhi for many years.

Spotting error.question: The children play on the park every evening.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'in' will be used in place of 'on' because– In - used to show a situation when something is enclosed (a park or ground) On - used for a situation when something is positioned above something else. Correct sentence- The children play in the park every evening.

Spotting error.question: This beautiful ring is made from gold.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'of' will be used in place of 'from' because from is used for chemical change and 'of' is for physical change. Correct sentence- This beautiful ring is made of gold.

Spotting error.question: Despite of working hard he failed the test.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'Despite' will be used in place of 'Despite of' because despite is followed by no preposition and inspite is followed by 'of' preposition in the same sense. Correct sentence- Despite working hard he failed the test.

Spotting error.question: Behavior modification techniques are often used to the training of police dogs.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'for the training' will be used in the place of 'to the training' because after 'used' (verb) 'for' preposition is used. Use something for something. Correct Sentence :- Behavior modification techniques are often used for training of police dogs.

Spotting error.question: He said that he thought off politics right when (1)/he was studying Intermediate and that (2)/ he had no fear of politics. (3)/ No error. (4)
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'about' will be used in place of 'off' because Thought is followed by 'about' preposition. Correct sentence He said that he thought about politics right when.....

Spotting error.question: The information contained in this electronic (1)/ message and any attachments to this message (2)/ is intended for the exclusive use of this recipient. (3)/ No error (4).
Spotting error.answer: is intended to the exclusive use
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'is intended to' will be used in place of 'is intended for' because 'intended to something' or 'intended to doing something' is used. Correct Sentence : The information contained in this electronic message and any attachments to this message is intended to the exclusive use of this recipient.

Spotting error.question: While provisions on equality and non-discrimination (1)/ would promote equal opportunity, (2)/ in the process, reservation at jobs should not be denied. (3)/ No error. (4)
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'in' will be used in place of 'at' because Reservation is followed by preposition 'in' Correct sentence- In the process in reservation in jobs should not be denied.

Spotting error.question: There is a barrier among the egghead and (1)/ the hoipolloi and it would be lazy (2)/ idealism to ignore it. (3)/ No error (4)
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'between' will be used in place of 'among' because for comparing two objects use of 'between' and among for more than two things. Correct sentence- There is a barrier between the egghead and….

Spotting error.question: The bottle slipped with my hand and broke into a thousand pieces.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'from my hand' will be used in place of 'with my hand' because preposition 'from' is used for separation of one thing from another. Correct sentence - The bottle slipped from my hand and broke into a thousand pieces.

Spotting error.question: She has been working tirelessly since hours.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'for hours' will be used in place of 'Since hour' because since is used for definite time and for is used for indefinite time. Here hours is showing indefinite time. So it is appropriate to use 'for' before it. since + point of time for + period of time. Correct sentence - She has been working tirelessly for hours.

Spotting error.question:
Identify the segment that contains a grammatical error. If there is no error, select 'No error'
Fate smiled above him in all his business ventures.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'on' preposition will be used with smile because smile on/upon is phrasal verb which means to make someone have good Luck/Success.

Spotting error.question:
Identify the segment which contains the grammatical error.
Lack of formal education did not prevent Lincoln to become a great leader.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'form becoming' will be used in place of 'to become' because prevent always followed by 'from' preposition and v + ing form. Note :– Prevent sth/sb from doing sth

Spotting error.question: In the sentence identify the segment which contains the grammatical error.  Darkness spilled like ink and began to spread at everything.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'spread over' will be used in place of 'spread at' because spread is followed by 'over' preposition.

Spotting error.question: Despite of his efforts he couldn't get a decent job.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'Despite' will be used in place of 'Despite of' because preposition 'of' is not used with despite. Note- Inspite of/Despite

Spotting error.question: The Principal requested to the Chief Guest to inaugurate the sports meet.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'the chief Guest to' will be used in place of 'to the chief Guest' because there is no need of 'to' preposition here with request, as it is in indirect speech of imperative sentence.

Spotting error.question: In the sentence identify the segment which contains the grammatical error. The launch of the small electric car will depend to the willingness of buyers to pay more for it.
options: of buyers to pay more for it
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'depend on the willingness' will be used in place of 'depend to the willingness' because 'on' preposition is used with depend.

Spotting error.question: In the sentence identify the segment which contains the grammatical error. India's largest car maker is evaluating the launch to a small electric car next year.
Spotting error.answer: launch of a small electric car
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'of' will be used in place of 'to' because according to the sense of the sentence it gives appropriate meaning with Launch.

Spotting error.question: In the sentence identify the segment which contains the grammatical error. I expect to return from Singapore during about a week's time.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence the use of During is superfluous and 'about' gives suitable meaning for the sentence.

Spotting error.question: In the sentence identify the segment which contains the grammatical error. I visited my friend to whom I had made an appointment.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'with Whom' preposition will be used in place of 'to whom' because it gives suitable meaning to the sentence.

Spotting error.question: On September 11, 2001, two hijacked aircrafts crashed to the World Trade Centre in New York.
options: World Trade Centre in New York
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence preposition 'into' will be used with crash. Crash into something (of vehicle)

Spotting error.question: Tilak rowed through the river and tied his boat on the other side.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence preposition 'across' will be used in place of 'through' because it gives appropriate meaning according to the sense of sentence.

Spotting error.question: The country has the lowest per capita income and needs to create jobs to the youth.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'Jobs for the youth' will be used in place of 'Jobs to the youth' because 'for' preposition give appropriate meaning to the sentence.

Spotting error.question: The manager was referring about the previous instances of loss to the employees during his address.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'to' will be used in place of 'about' because verb 'refer' followed by 'to' preposition.

Spotting error.question: Though she was able to finish the work on time she couldn't do that out in fear.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'out of fear' will be used in place of 'out in fear' because it gives appropriate meaning of the sentence.

Spotting error.question: My hotel in Goa had a wonderful view of the sea in the window.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'From the window' will be used in place of in 'in the window'. Because it gives suitable meaning according to the sense of the sentence.

Spotting error.question: Did you tell to your mother that you saw her friend at the theater?
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'Did you tell' will be used instead of 'Did you tell to', because preposition 'to' is not used after verb 'tell'.

Spotting error.question: A panel has been formed to look within the security needs of college students.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'To look into' will be used in the place of 'to look within' because it give suitable meaning. Phrase :– Look into– to try discover the fact about something.

Spotting error.question: In the evening he likes to read books and articles that have nothing to do of his work.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'Do with his work' will be used in place of 'do of his work', because the use of 'do with' is appropriate in the sense of passing time. Which means having or possessing.

Spotting error.question: The city of Banaras is widely known from its ghats and temples.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'for' will be used in place of 'from'. because it gives appropriate meaning to the sentence. because from is used to indicate. The point in space at which a journey, motion or action parts. known for something known to somebody

Spotting error.question: The child always goes for sleep with his teddy bear./No error
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'Goes to sleep' will be used instead of 'goes for sleep', because 'Go to sleep' usually implies that the person is in a place designated for sleeping.

Spotting error.question: Identify the segment in the sentence which contains the grammatical error. Sakshi discussed about the problem with her manager very briefly.
Spotting error.explanation: The use of 'about' will not be appropriate in the above sentence. Note- The verbs discuss, order and stress are transitive and therefore they are not followed by any preposition.

Spotting error.question: Identify the segment in the sentence which contains the grammatical error. Pallavi was relaxing in the beach at this time yesterday.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'Relaxing on the' will be used in place of 'relaxing in the'. because On the beach-it means you are literally on the surface of a beach.

Spotting error.question: The travel agent is making the arrangements from my trips.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'For my trips' will be used in place of 'from my trips'. Because for is used when something is related or concerned with someone. It also refers to when use talk about a purpose or a reason for something.

Spotting error.question: Identify the segment in the sentence which contains the grammatical error. Diksha has been in a grumpy mood from she got up.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'Since' will be used in place of 'from'. Because it is clear from the use of 'has been' that 'the sentence' is in present perfect continuous tense. Hence 'since' will be used before point of time (She got up).

Spotting error.question: To escape floods, a tigress took refuge at a vegetable garden
Spotting error.explanation: 'In' preposition will be used instead of 'at' in the above sentence. 'Take' refuse in :– (protection from danger) is used as idiomatic.

Spotting error.question: The robbers broke in the house at night.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'Broke into' will be used in place of 'broke in' because 'broke into (to enter a building by force)' gives appropriate meaning for the sentence.

Spotting error.question: He sat in his stool and shut his eyes to recollect what work he had for the day.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence, 'On' is used instead of 'in'. Because the use of 'on' is appropriate in the sense of sitting on a stool. Because there is no hand in it. While 'in the chair, in the sofa, in the bed' is used.

Spotting error.question: We have been staying at the hotel since the last ten days.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence , 'for' will be used in place of 'since'. Because the use of 'for' shows an indefinite time. (the last ten days)

Spotting error.question: There is no point of arguing over something so unimportant.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'No point in' will be used instead of 'no point of'. Because 'no point in' is a phrase which means- 'will not yield any worthwhile results'.

Spotting error.question: They have been living in Boston from ten years.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence, the use of 'for' will be appropriate in place of 'from'. because it is clear from the use of have been + verb + ing that the sentence is in present perfect continuous tense. And since/for + time is used in this tense. Since– point of time (2 o' clock , January 1988)/for period of time (2 hours, 2 months, 10 years).

Spotting error.question: One could argue that these are the compulsions of parliamentary democracy for smooth functioning for the State.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'Functioning of the state' will be used in place of Functioning for the state. Because preposition 'of' will be used to denote the possession.

Spotting error.question: After finishing his tiring game, Rohan leaned by the wall.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence, 'against the wall' will be used in place of 'by the wall'. Lean against something - to sit or stand with part of your body touching something as a support.

Spotting error.question: She complained about her weak eyes and lamented about the necessity from spectacles.
Spotting error.explanation: The above sentence 'Of' (preposition) will be used in place of 'from', because the use of 'necessity of + something' is appropriate.

Spotting error.question: Does he like to go for sightseeing when he is in holiday?
Spotting error.explanation: According to the sense of the above sentence 'On' preposition will be used in place of 'in' before the word holiday. Because 'on' gives proper meaning in the sense. 'On' is used in the following way. On Diwali, On Holi, On Monday, On Holiday, On vacation etc.

Spotting error.question: The soldiers had no choice when to obey the commander.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence ‘But to obey’ would be appropriate in place ‘when to obey’. Because ‘but’ is worked as a conjunction to join two contrast sentences.

Spotting error.question: While the night we felt afraid as the resort was very dark and secluded.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence, ' as the night' will be used in place of 'while the night', because some conjunctions are not used alone, they are always used in pairs like  So____as,/Too_____to,/Either_______or,/as_____as,/ Neither_____nor etc.

Spotting error.question: I can clearly/recollect the day/as I first/met you.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'When' (conjunction) will be used in place of conjunction 'as'. because the correct from will be  "When I first meet you"

Spotting error.question: No sooner did/the child start crying/then the mother/hugged him.
Spotting error.explanation: In the given sentence, 'than the mother' will be used instead of 'then the mother, because 'than' is always used with no-sooner.  No sooner................than  Scarcely/hardly..............when

Spotting error.question: Until I was/still a little weak, /I decided to walk home/from the metro station.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'Although I was' will be used in place of 'Until I was' because 'until' is a time denoting conjunction while 'although' is a contrast denoting conjunction which gives the appropriate meaning to the sentence.

Spotting error.question: If you rent a house near your office, it will save you time as well as also money.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'Also' will not be used after 'as well as' because the use of also is superfluous in the sentence.

Spotting error.question: Notwithstanding we were / all busy that weekend / we had to / cancel the outing.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence, 'because of' will be used in place of 'Notwithstanding' because it gives suitable meaning, according to the sense of sentence.

Spotting error.question: We must plan how can we cope with the present situation.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'How we can' will be used in place of 'how can we' because 'how' is used as a conjunction not as a question word. because the sentence is in affermative.

Spotting error.question: The postman travelled by the cycle, often wading through (1)/swamps of passed through jungles (2)/ in order to reach the villages (3)/ No error (4)
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'And' will be used in place of 'of' because 'and' is used to join two noun or clause.

Spotting error.question: Preeti is absent from the meeting due to she is out of station.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence, the use of because in place of 'due to' would be appropriate. Because in the sense of reason 'because' is used as a conjunction.

Spotting error.question: Zoya won the first prize in the race unless she stumbled and fell.
Spotting error.answer: in spite of she stumbled and fell
Spotting error.explanation: 'Inspite of /despite' would be appropriate in place of 'unless' in the above sentence. It means –: in spite of (used to show that somebody did not intend to do the thing mentioned). Hence it gives suitable meaning, according to the sense of sentence.

Spotting error.question: Miss Marple is neither a good singer or the good stage artist.
Spotting error.explanation: 'Nor the good' will be used in place of 'or the good' in the above sentence. Because co-relative conjunction of neither is used with 'nor'. Neither..............Nor Either................Or

Spotting error.question: We had to decline several orders in case that the production was held up due to labour strike.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'Because' conjunction would be appropriate in place of 'in case that'. Because the use of 'because' conjunction shows the reason which gives suitable meaning for the sentence.

Spotting error.question: She lost a big order from a known showroom in case of her own carelessness.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence, 'because' is used in place of 'in case of '. The use of 'because' (conjunction) is showing the reason. Which gives the complete meaning of sentence.

Spotting error.question: Cyclone ldai killed at least 157 people in Zimbabwe and Mozambique although it tore across Southern Africa.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence Conjunction 'because/as' would be appropriate in place of 'Although'. Rule- Because is used before another part of speech to give the reason for something.

Spotting error.question: She got two quick promotions in order that she has good communication skills.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'Because' will be used in place of 'In order that'. Because is used to talk about in the sense of reason.

Spotting error.question: No sooner did the dark clouds gather in the sky when the electricity was switched off.
options: when the electricity was switched off
Spotting error.answer: than the electricity was switched off
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence, 'than' will be used in place of 'when'. Because the following structure is used. No sooner did sub verb .........than No sooner + had + sub+verb .........than Hardly /Scarcely had sub verb .........when

Spotting error.question: Our nation can make significant growth but if we all work collectively.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence the use of conjunction 'but' is superfluous. because conjunction 'if' will be used for condition. Which gives the complete meaning of the sentence.

Spotting error.question: Inspite Smita had taken part in many television serials earlier, this was the first time she was going to host a live show.
Spotting error.answer: Inspite of Smita had taken part
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence, 'Inspite of' will be used in place of 'Inspite'. Because preposition 'of' is used with 'Inspite'. While 'despite' is used without 'of' in the same sense.

Spotting error.question: No sooner did I reach the station when the train left.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence , 'than' will be used in place of 'when'. Note- Here 'No sooner––––than' will be used as a Conjunction.

Spotting error.question: Even Sharat tried his best, he could not clear all the examination papers in one attempt.
Spotting error.answer: Even though Sharat tried his best
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence Conjunction 'Even though' will be used in the place of adverb 'even'. Because 'even though' is used when Result have not been received according to the work.

Spotting error.question: As you know that I always like to have ice-cream after my dinner.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence' 'As you know' will be used in place of 'As you know that'. Because when 'as' is used at the beginning of the sentence, then 'that' is not used as a conjunction while (,) comma is used in place of 'that'.

Spotting error.question: Different-coloured natural foods not only put a smile on children's faces and also benefit their overall growth.
options: put a smile on children's faces
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'But also benefit' would be appropriate in place of 'And also benefit'. Because co-relative conjunction 'but also' is used with not only.

Spotting error.question: Despite of her tiredness Meera went into the kitchen to make some dinner for the children.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence, 'Despite' will be used in place of 'Despite of'. Because 'of' is not used with Despite.

Spotting error.question: No matter what that the mother did the baby didn't stop crying.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence, 'what' will be used as a conjunction in place of 'what that', because 'no matter what' is a phrase followed by a noun. Hence the use of 'that' is unnecessary.

Spotting error.question: If they said nothing, she could sense their disapproval of her suggestion.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence, 'although they said nothing' will be used in place of 'if they said nothing'. Because 'although' is used connector between the two contrast sentences. While 'if' is used in the sense of condition.

Spotting error.question: Do not let the opportunity slip away and you will repent./No error
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'Or' will be used in place of 'And'. because 'Or' is used to say otherwise. It is used to introduce the consequences of something not being done.

Spotting error.question: Ram cannot withdraw all his money unless he does not given a prior notice.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence, unless he gives' will be used in place of 'unless he does not give'. Because 'not' is not used with 'unless'. 'Unless' is itself a negative word (conjunction) which means – if ---- not, except if (if not, not until) here not is superflous.

Spotting error.question: Sushmita's youngest sister is not only beautiful but even intelligent also.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence, 'but also intelligent' will be use in place of 'but even intelligent also in the sentence. because not only------------but also'' is used as correlative Conjunction, therefore words of the same parts of speech are added to it.

Spotting error.question: In 79 A.D., the Mount Vesuvius blew/its top, burying the ancient/ cities of Pompeii and Herculaneum.
options: In 79 A.D., the Mount Vesuvius blew
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence article 'the' will not be used before mountain name.

Spotting error.question: An appeasements policies/were all but a sham to misdirect/the local groups.
options: were all but a sham to misdirect
Spotting error.explanation: The segment of the above sentence – ‘An appeasements policies’ is grammatically incorrect because the article ‘An’ is used before indefinite singular countable noun. Article ‘the’ is used before the singular/plural countable noun in the place of article ‘An’.

Spotting error.question: Her evaluation will give/me a best indication of/where I stand in the class.
options: where I stand in the class
Spotting error.explanation: In the above given sentence, the segment 'me a best indication of' is grammatically incorrect, because before the superlative adjective (best) article 'the' is used in the place of 'a'.

Spotting error.question: She was waiting for a opportunity to start her own business.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence option (c) 'for a opportunity' are grammatically incorrect because indefinite article 'an' is used in the place of article 'a', because Article 'An' is used before a singular Noun with a vowel sound. ⇒ 'A' is used before a singular noun with a consonant sound.

Spotting error.question: You should / see a oculist; / your eyes look / worse today.
Spotting error.explanation: For the above given sentence, the option (b) is incorrect because 'see a oculist' is replaced by 'see an oculist'. Note- Indefinite article 'an' will be used before vowel sound. (oculist)

Spotting error.question:
Select the grammatically correct sentence.
(a) It was the hectic day for Susan with a lot of purchase and the couple of meetings.
(b) It was a hectic day for Susan with the lot of purchase and a couple of meetings.
(c) It was a hectic day for Susan with the lot of purchase and an couple of meetings.
(d) It was a hectic day for Susan with the lot of purchase and an couple of meetings.
options: It was the hectic day for Susan with a lot of purchase and the couple of meetings.
It was a hectic day for Susan with the lot of purchase and a couple of meetings.
It was a hectic day for Susan with the lot of purchase and an couple of meetings.
It was a hectic day for Susan with the lot of purchase and an couple of meetings.
Spotting error.answer: It was a hectic day for Susan with a lot of purchases and a couple of meetings.
Spotting error.explanation: The grammatically correct sentence of the above sentence is option (d) 'It was a hectic day for Susan with a lot of purchases and a couple of meetings.' Note:- 'A' is the 'indefinite Article', use before the singular countable noun with consonant sound. ⇒ 'A lot of'/lots of' can both be used with plural countable nouns and singular uncountable nouns.

Spotting error.question: Aniket lives (A) / in the small apartment (B) / in the suburbs (C).
Spotting error.explanation: The above given sentence, the segment 'in the small apartment' is grammatically incorrect, because article 'the' will be changed into 'a' before 'small apartment'. It is not specifying a particular or specific apartment. Hence, article 'the' is inappropriate.

Spotting error.question:
Identify the sentence that correctly uses the indefinite article.
(a) She is a Indian artist married to a European engineer.
(b) She is an Indian artist married to a European engineer.
(c) She is a Indian artist married to an European engineer.
(d) She is an Indian artist married to an European engineer.
options: She is a Indian artist married to a European engineer.
She is an Indian artist married to a European engineer.
She is a Indian artist married to an European engineer.
She is an Indian artist married to an European engineer.
Spotting error.answer: She is an Indian artist married to a European engineer.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence correctly use of the indefinite article is in option (b). Correct Sentence- She is an Indian artist married to a European engineer.

Spotting error.question: The historians / are a great / asset to the / field of academia.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'Historians' will be used in place of 'the historians' because article 'the' is used in definite sense and here historians are not definite.

Spotting error.question: Babbal is / a oldest member / in our / Black Ice Club.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence, the segment ' a oldest member' is grammatically incorrect because article 'the' is used before the superlative adjective (oldest member).

Spotting error.question: Honesty / is / a best / policy.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence option (a) 'a best is grammatically incorrect part. Because article 'the' is used before the superlative adjective (best).

Spotting error.question: A writer who wrote this book has been selected for this year's literature award.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence, 'the writer who' will be used in place of 'A writer who', because the writer is adefinite noun. Therefore definite article 'the' will be used before writer.

Spotting error.question: We require the efficient electrician for changing the wiring of our house.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'An' will be used in place of 'the' in the above sentence because in indefinite sense, article 'an' is used before vowel sound word.

Spotting error.question: Ronaldo is/a famous/player of/the football.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence, 'Football' will be used in place of 'the football'. Because article 'the' is used in definite sense. In general sense a noun is used without an article.

Spotting error.question: This is /too grave sin/to be/pardoned.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence, 'too grave a sin' will be used in place of 'too grave sin' because here the use of sin (noun) is used in indefinite sense. Hence Indefinite article 'a' will be used.

Spotting error.question: Antique diamond necklace / was stolen / from the museum.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'An antique' will be used in place of 'Antique' because in indefinite sense, article 'an' is used before vowel sound word.

Spotting error.question: Athens was/most luminous/ of all city-states/ for ancient Greece.
Spotting error.explanation: Definite article 'the' is used with superlative degree (most). Hence 'The' most luminous will be used in place of 'most luminous'.

Spotting error.question: It was / the very well-directed film / and we enjoyed it.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence, ' a very well directed film, will be used instead of 'the very well directed film', because 'the' is used in definite sense while 'a' is used in indefinite sense. Hence Article 'a' will be used.

Spotting error.question: The earthy / fragrance of soil / after a first rain / is always refreshing.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence, 'After the first rain' will be used instead of 'after a first rain' because definite article 'the' is used before ordinal number (first, second, third etc).

Spotting error.question: The telecom growth story is a important component of the broader story of India.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'An important component' will be used in place of 'a important component', because article 'an' is used before the word starting with vowel sound. (important)

Spotting error.question: he is / struggling to make / a honest living .
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence 'An honest living' will be used in place of a honest living. Because indefinite article 'an' is used before the noun of the vowel sound.

Spotting error.question: Our team leader / told us to be at the work / by 9 a.m. / the next morning.
options: told us to be at the work
Spotting error.answer: told us to be at work
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence, 'at work' will be used instead of 'at the work', because article 'the' is used in specific sense. Hence, definite article 'the' will not be used.

Spotting error.question: Go to the ninth block on the left-hand side and take a sharpest turn to reach Bunny’s house on the right.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence, article 'the' will be used in place of 'a', because definite article 'the' is used before superlative degree. (sharpest)

Spotting error.question: I think/he has/settled/in United States.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence, 'In the united states' will be used instead of in united states. Because article 'the' is used before the name of some country. Note → Some countries as - The United States of America (USA), The Athens, The Philippines, The West Indies

Spotting error.question: The sea has become/an cheap dumping ground/ for all kinds/of waste products.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence, 'a' will be used in place of 'an', because the pronunciation of 'cheap' is pronounced with (consonant sound). So Indefinite article 'a' will be used before it. While 'an' is used before vowel sound.

Spotting error.question: There was enough evidence to convict him on selling of fake medicines.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence, 'on the selling of' will be used in place of 'on selling of', because when two nouns are joined by 'of' then 'the' is used before the first noun.

Spotting error.question: Although this is a narrowest street, many large trucks can enter it.
Spotting error.explanation: In the above sentence, 'The narrowest' will be used instead of 'a narrowest', because definite article 'the' is used before superlative form (narrowest).

Spotting error.question: Do you mind lending me your book for a hour?
